required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical and Cost-effectiveness of Fluoride Varnish Versus Resin Based Sealant (Part 2)
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical and Cost-effectiveness of Fluoride Varnish Versus Resin Based Sealant in Newly Erupted Permanent Molars in Group of Egyptian Children: A Randomized Clinical Trial(Part 2).

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the present study is determine the cost-effectiveness, clinical- effectiveness, acceptability and adverse effect of resin sealants versus the fluoride varnish for the prevention of dental caries on newly erupted permanent molars.

detailed_description.textblock:
A Cochrane systematic reviews found low quality evidence supporting Current practice guidelines that recommend the use of Resin based fissure sealant over Fluoride varnish in prevent dental caries. However, they did not address the cost-effectiveness, A more recent systematic review and meta-analysis concluded that no statistical significance difference between Resin based fissure sealant and Fluoride varnish with a high-quality evidence in prevent dental caries.
This trial will measure cost effectiveness and clinical effectiveness for resin fissure sealant and fluoride varnish.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: The study will be randomized, allocation-blinded, two-arm, parallel-group trial. The participants will be randomized on a 1: 1 allocation ratio to receive one of the following interventions: Resin-based fissure sealant FS. Fluoride varnish FV
study_design_info.masking_description: No one is blinded ( unfortunately) as fissure sealant will be obvious

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of one year
primary_outcome.description: Clinical-effectiveness (will be measured by DFS) Clinical effectiveness (continuous outcome will be measured with DFS D Decayed in permanent molar Filling in permanent molar S Surface

secondary_outcome.measure: Cost-effectiveness (will be measured with Incremental cost effective ratio ICER
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of one year
secondary_outcome.description: Cost-effectiveness (will be measured with Cost-effectiveness will be calculated based on the following measures:- Economic measures (continuous outcome, (money) will be measured with Calculate The total cost of each of FV and FS in every visit) . Clinical effectiveness (continuous outcome will be measured with DFS.

other_outcome.measure: Time of application (continuous outcome, (minutes) will be measured with stopwatch.
other_outcome.time_frame: Through application of interventions in treatment visit( baseline)
other_outcome.description: Time of application (continuous outcome, (minutes) will be measured with stopwatch.

other_outcome.measure: acceptability will be measured by questionnaire
other_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of one year
other_outcome.description: I will ask the parent and child if this trial is acceptable or not

other_outcome.measure: adverse effect will be measured by questionnaire
other_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of one year
other_outcome.description: Questionnaire for the parent (allergy, diarrhea or vomiting )

arm_group.description: Fluoride varnish (3M Clinpro White Varnish 5% sodium fluoride). Group (1)
Resin based fissure sealant (3M Clinpro Sealant, light cure, low viscosity, fluoride release).group (2)

intervention.intervention_name: Fluoride varnish (3M Clinpro White Varnish 5% sodium fluoride).
intervention.description: 5% sodium fluoride Varnish is a fluoride varnish which is applied to tooth surfaces

intervention.intervention_name: Resin based fissure sealant (3M Clinpro Sealant)
intervention.description: teeth will be isolated with cotton rolls and saliva ejector than etching for pits and fissure sealant

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- â€¢ Healthy children with no physical or mental disorders. Children with newly fully erupted permanent molars (PMs).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Teeth will be excluded from the study if they had any of the following:
- Dental caries in dentine
- History of pain or swelling. Parents refused their children participate in the trial
